programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was well liked and successful, which made the brutality of the crime even harder to understand.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A successful stockbroker told his wife he'd be working late, and when he didn't come home, she reported him missing.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In a tragic twist of fate, just days after the woman sold her home and moved to a modest trailer, a fire took both the trailer and her life. But the autopsy proved this was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000,¾Kristine Fitzhugh¾failed to show up for her music class and her husband Ken found her dead at the bottom of the stairs of their Palo Alto home. Upon further investigation, luminol reveals evidence of murder in the kitchen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 12, 1994, Crystal Perry was viciously murdered in her home in Bridgton, Maine. Michael Hutchinson, 32, was found guilty of murder in the 1994 slaying at Perry's home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young man was killed in a mysterious car crash, but the evidence at the scene led investigators to believe it was not an accident. Forensic science revealed what really happened, and the truth devastated three families.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the number and volume of bloodstains at the scene was greater than usual, it was up to forensic scientists to find out why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Texas real estate agent Sarah Anne Walker was found brutally murdered in a model home. Weeks later, a witness came forward who may have seen the killer. Police used forensic hypnosis to help him recall every detail of the man's appearance.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had been sexually assaulted and stabbed to death on the beach. A pair of men's tennis shoes was discovered near her body. Police were sure that if they found the man who fit the shoes, they would also find the man who committed the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, 19-year-old Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. For ten years, her disappearance remained a mystery, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin 'Butch' Hinton.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A bullet-riddled car, a missing driver, and no witnesses. Was this an ambush or a random attack? Had the victim been abducted or was she dead? The answers lay in a unique clue, so tiny it was measured in millionths of a meter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1969, 25-year-old phone operator¾Diane Maxwell is raped and murdered. Her brother promised he'd find out who was responsible and bring the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Christina Sanoubane was murdered in her Cedar Rapids apartment after moving away from her abusive boyfriend. There are clues at the scene: bloody footprints and DNA from the victim's rape kit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead, and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator. With the help of a forensic geologist, they identified the most unlikely suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The killer probably hoped to cover his tracks by staging the crime scene. But investigators saw through the attempt almost immediately, and turned to forensic science to learn what really happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence collected by a prescient medical examiner could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Lives changed in the 20 years following an unsolved murder, and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed not only a clue no one had seen before but also the identity of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman in the back of the truck was flailing her arms, screaming. They thought she was doing something dangerous for the fun of it. But when they found a jacket near a pool of blood, they knew what they'd seen wasn't a joy ride.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl ran and hid when she saw her grandmother being beaten to death, but the man followed, beat and assaulted her. She said the assailant was her uncle, who was convicted. She recanted her testimony years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After inspecting storm damage to a home in Tampa, the insurance assessor simply disappeared. Thirty hours later, her body was found in a nearby river. But the killer had been careless.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1989, the dead bodies of Joan Rogers and her two teenage daughters were found floating in Tampa Bay.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy man and his wife were attacked by three masked men outside their luxurious Louisiana home. He was shot dead and she was forced to open their hidden safe. To solve the crime, police would have to find out who knew about the concealed safe.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Brian & Beverly Mauck were found dead in their Graham, Washington home. Using a bloody palm print and shoe prints at the scene, investigators focus their attention on Daniel Tavares, who had previously been inking a tattoo on Brian's back.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Judy Southern arrived home from work and was shot by a gunman waiting within. Her husband Allen arrived shortly afterwards, called 911 to report his wife had been shot and drove her to the hospital.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A lifelong resident of the tiny town of Lefroy, Tasmania was murdered outside his own home. Robbery appeared to be the motive, but with no suspects, the investigation came to a halt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2005, David Castor suffered a slow, agonizing death over a period of days. His wife¾Stacey¾maintained it was suicide, even though it was done with antifreeze.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: James Kenneth Elmen Jr. abducted Julie Estes, then 21, from the Southside convenience store where she worked in 1985. He raped and murdered her. Her body was found the next day, but the killing went unsolved until 2003.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman was dead. The man had been shot four times and survived. When the man's version of events was at odds with the evidence, investigators turned to forensic science, hoping to determine if this was a botched robbery, or cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Brian & Beverly Mauck were found dead in their Graham, Washington home. Using a bloody palm print and shoe prints at the scene, investigators focus their attention on Daniel Tavares, who had previously been inking a tattoo on Brian's back.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Shamaia Smith disappeared from the strip club she worked at in East Hartford, CT. Police look at various customers of the strip club, but focus on local businessman Kenneth Otto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2005, David Castor suffered a slow, agonizing death over a period of days. His wife¾Stacey¾maintained it was suicide, even though it was done with antifreeze.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the 'dirt' on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, 19-year-old Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. For ten years, her disappearance remained a mystery, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin 'Butch' Hinton.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, when Derrick Duehren returned to his Oregon home, it had burned to the ground and his wife Roxanne's charred remains were found in the rubble. Investigators set out to determine if it was an unfortunate accident or arson and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, funeral director Lonnie Turner, Sr. was found shot to death. His son Lonnie Jr. became the prime suspect, particularly after it was discovered that the murder was committed with his gun. However, he had an alibi for the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, when teenager Tara Munsey goes missing after a work shift at a Virginia restaurant, it is unknown if she ran away or if she was the victim of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Christmas eve 2005, the corpse of a black male is found burning near Baltimore. He's eventually identified as 26-year-old Wesley Person. Distinctive building materials from the 1930s found near the body play a crucial role in solving this case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence collected by a prescient medical examiner could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a dedicated, well-respected teacher disappeared, police had to determine if she'd gone on vacation without telling anyone, or if she was the victim of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Even though their daughter had run away before, she'd always come back. Her parents were sure this time would be no different, but they were wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Rebecca Barney and her soon-to-be ex-husband Fred were found shot to death in their Tulsa, Oklahoma, home, which had been set on fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Foul play is suspected when Fort Worth factory worker Glenda Furch disappears in September 2007 after completing her shift.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman had been sexually assaulted, stabbed repeatedly, and left for dead. When someone who fit that description practically turned himself in, police were sure they had their man... until the DNA evidence proved them wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run accident claimed the life of a high school athlete, everyone in town mourned his passing. Finding the killer was a long shot at best.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Virginia Beach police arrive at the Makdessi apartment to find Elise Makdessi and her lover Quincy Brown dead.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, construction manager Darrell North was found dead in his work trailer in Ft. Worth, Texas. When investigators arrived, they found that he had been stabbed 46 times, indicating a personal relationship between the victim and the attacker.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was well liked and successful, which made the brutality of the crime even harder to understand.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Darlene VanderGiesen received threatening emails and then disappeared. Tracking the source of the emails led police to the home of Daphne Wright, where they believe a murder was committed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible... and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if he'd signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, Colorado real estate developer Alan Helmick was found shot to death at home by his wife Miriam, who then became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Christina Sanoubane was murdered in her Cedar Rapids apartment after moving away from her abusive boyfriend. There are clues at the scene: bloody footprints and DNA from the victim's rape kit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most brazen crimes of the 20th century.¾Adolph Coors III, chairman of the Coors Brewing Company, was kidnapped and held for ransom prompting one of the most intense manhunts in United States history.

programme.title: S13:E16 - Desenmascarado
programme.desc: Un violador en serie anda suelto en una ciudad de Texas. Nadie sabía dónde atacaría a continuación, pero la audacia de sus ataques y la escalada de violencia contra sus víctimas hicieron que encontrarlo fuera imperativo.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The development of technology could help solve a murder case that is twelve years old.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run boating accident caused the death of a popular young man, investigators faced the daunting task of searching for one boat among 1200 others.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, 82-year-old Kathryn Bishop was found dead in her Pennsylvania home. Tiny clues on the victim's body would tell police what happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 54-year-old Gayle Isleib was ambushed in her Manchester, Connecticut driveway and shot to death. Now police must determine if love had turned into obsession... and a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college co-ed vanished without a trace, her fellow students were concerned about her safety and their own.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, St. Cloud teenager Jason MacLennan returned home after a night out with friends and discovered his father Ken's body lying in a pool of blood.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression apparently took her own life. But her sister told police that, a year before her death, she said if anything were to happen to her, there was a note in the china cabinet.¾

programme.title: Sweet Mahogany 3: The Final Entanglement
programme.desc: The lives of Mahogany Andrews and those around her are drastically changed after devastating news changes relationships and reveals dark secrets from the past that will have a major impact on everyone's future.

programme.title: Thicker the Berry, the Sweeter the Juice 2
programme.desc: A rising celebrity news reporter has to choose between new love or the safer route when an ex-boyfriend reappears in her life.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: Her Other Man
programme.desc: Looking to spice up their marriage, Kennedy invites another man, Billy, into the bedroom with her husband Ronny. When Billy is found dead, Ronny is being questioned about his murder.

programme.title: Unsecured
programme.desc: Bobby, haunted by the infidelity of his ex-wife, enters a new relationship with Lakeisha while grappling with deep-seated insecurities. Unbeknownst to Lakeisha, his past resurfaces when a witness claims to have seen him involved in a murder.

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: Exposed

programme.title: Murder Gardens 2
programme.desc: After serving ten years in prison, Chase returns to Miami Gardens with a goal of reclaiming his life. But the criminal empire that he was once part of has changed and his older brother Rell is now one of the heads. He recruits Chase for one last job.

programme.title: Three of a Kind
programme.desc: Three years after graduation, college friends Hope, Chanta and May eagerly reunite for Hope's wedding to her fiancé, Robert. As the weekend unfolds, a secret emerges. When the truth comes to light, the celebration descends into chaos.

programme.title: Troublesome
programme.desc: A veteran detective and his rookie partner investigate a homicide case involving a vengeful kingpin who unleashes bloodshed across the city.

programme.title: Saints 2 Aints
programme.desc: Chiffona hopes to reconnect with Orvalle, her former sweetheart, but her lifelong friend Gevia is desperately trying to steal him for herself.

programme.title: Sex and the Single Lady 2
programme.desc: Tamia, Kai, Petra and Ebony face challenges that put their friendship to the test when the ties that once bonded them are broken.

programme.title: She Time
programme.desc: Bored with her life and fading marriage, a woman encounters an old acquaintance on a girls’ night out and begins an affair with him.

programme.title: Revisiting the Heart
programme.desc: A lead homicide detective tries to balance her personal life with the demands and challenges that come with working a tough murder case.

programme.title: Christmas Family Ties
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her mother, Amaya pleads to Santa to bring her family together for Christmas like they used to. Her father David, having fallen out with his siblings after his own mother's death, decides to bring her to their ancestral family home for the holiday. Will they survive the holiday with their own family dysfunction and financial ruin hanging over their heads?

programme.title: Festive Fling
programme.desc: After Shelly's painful divorce, she was left feeling like the black sheep of the family. Desperate to move on from the pain of her past, she invites her co-worker Greg to visit her family to pretend to be her boyfriend to deflect her family's unwanted comments. Little did she know, that her holiday fling, would become a holiday thing.

programme.title: Love and Leftovers
programme.desc: Jacob is a successful chef with big dreams of opening his own restaurant, but struggles in his personal life due to his demanding girlfriend, Drina. When Lisa, a strong-willed and grounded woman comes along and sees his potential, Jacob finds himself torn between something familiar, or something new.

programme.title: Thanksgiving Roast 2
programme.desc: When her grandmother begs her to visit for Thanksgiving, Mya brings along a fake boyfriend to appease her family’s concerns about her love life.

programme.title: Thanksgiving With The Carters
programme.desc: A family tries to find common ground with its newest members, as they honor their tradition of Thanksgiving surprise, where each person attempts to surprise the family with something unique and positive.

programme.title: Family Thanksgiving
programme.desc: This hilarious holiday comedy takes on the dysfunction of Thanksgiving as a man tries to keep his calm with his nosy and dysfunctional family members.

programme.title: Thanksgiving With the Carters: 2nd Helping
programme.desc: The Carter Family is back to celebrate a positive and traditional Thanksgiving at a wooded cabin, but chaos and a ruined dinner have to be fixed.

programme.title: Thanksgiving Roast
programme.desc: Preston must win over Madison's crazy family over Thanksgiving, in the hopes to obtain her hand in marriage.

programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Rusty Updike has asked his ex-wife Vesta on a cruise. The couple haven't seen each other for 15 years but Vesta decides that a cruise with her ex might make for a nice change of pace.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A cabdriver develops chest pains and seizures; a hotel manager is found dead on the steps of his apartment.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: On a Texas highway, a fire is discovered having burnt three bodies beyond recognition. Dr. G finds bullets in the bodies and determines that they were all shot before being set on fire.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Melissa Riobe's life is ruled by her addiction to drugs. Now, the 42-year-old woman has learned how to buy powerful prescription drugs online without a doctor's note.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A man is found dead in a motel room due to multiple shotgun wounds. Dr. G proves the scene isn't what it seems.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man arrives in the ER with blue skin, doctors struggle to save a plane crash survivor and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman gets stuck in a toilet bowl; a man's leg is mangled by a stump grinder; a nurse collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient can't remember the past 20 years and her doctor desperately needs to know what she's forgotten.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient comes in with progressing paralysis, a boy is crushed by an ATV and more.

programme.desc: An embarrassing secret prohibits a heart attack patient from being rushed to the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients are admitted into the ER, both experiencing seizures. An elderly man's lung collapses.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor's friend arrives at the hospital combative and out of control, attacking the doctor in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man critically injured by a boat propeller; a discharged patient causes a deadly chain of events.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is impaled in the abdomen by a stiletto heel. A seemingly healthy outdoorsman has a series of seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors use a robot operated by a specialist at another hospital to treat a seizing 7-year-old boy.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two patients arrive at the ER with bizarre fishing injuries; a martial arts instructor suffers abdominal pains; teenage victims of a car crash fill a small ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A six-year-old boy suffers a life-threatening stroke. A man has a camp stove stuck on his privates.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus sword-swallower suffers from a persistent case of hiccups; a mother and daughter mysteriously collapse in the ER; a woman loses control of her legs at her daughter's graduation.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A grown man suddenly begins acting bizarrely like a child, a wheezing woman has a breathing problem and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An unresponsive golfer needs immediate surgery, three near-naked adults wreak havoc in the ER and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three patients sneak their pets into the hospital, causing pandemonium in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A live boa constrictor wrapped around a man's arm is biting his wrist and won't let go.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A surfer is impaled between the legs by the fin of his surfboard.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Two skydivers are rushed in, a bride-to-be gets her finger stuck in a make-up jar and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman who inhaled toxic fumes now believes her neighbors want to kill her.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Three emergency deliveries in the ER cause a turf war, gunshot victims have a surprising connection and more.

programme.desc: A knifing victim suddenly starts seizing and his doctors can't treat him until they figure out the cause.

programme.desc: A surgeon requires urgent treatment after falling off a bed while trying to help his patient.

programme.desc: A grown man screams incessantly, a young mother is ice cold and a boy denies overdosing on drugs.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words
programme.desc: Based on the playground game Tug-O-War, teams of two compete to answer word-clue questions correctly and pull the flag on the tug of war rope to their side.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty brave Brits have volunteered for an expedition to the arctic wastelands of Argentina.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Winter Wipeout has the awards show to end all awards shows –The Snow Globes.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It’s Christmas down on the Winter Wipeout course in Argentina!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 contestants take on four gruelling courses to win the title of Wipeout Champion.

programme.title: 101 Ways to Leave a Gameshow
programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the fifth week of the TV Show and none of the participants have been able to cross the Big Balls.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Buoys, Field Goal Swing, Big Donuts and Tippy Tables are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and, as usual, contestants face different games!

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Topple towers, Cookie Cutter, The Tails, Teeter Totters and Crazy Beams are among the over-the-top obstacles on this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This episode welcomes a set of contestants to take on some hard obstacles for the cash prize and the trophy.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the 7 previous winners compete to be the Champion of Champions.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The first episode of the game show where 50 members of the public compete with almost no chance of winning.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier and The Dizzy Dummies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout UK
programme.desc: Contestants take on one of television’s largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: It's time for 'The Final' of 'Total Wipeout' season 2.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see 10 celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Flight 666
programme.desc: Passengers and crew on an international flight are attacked by unseen forces that might be more or less deadly than one of their fellow travelers.

programme.title: Battledogs
programme.desc: When a strange virus threatens to destroy New York, a rogue general uses the disease to create super soldiers while his colleague searches for a cure.

programme.title: Invitation to Hell
programme.desc: When a scientist and his family move to a new town, they are cornered into joining a local health club, which harbors dark and hideous secrets.

programme.title: Phantom Racer
programme.desc: A racecar driver, whose rival perished in a fiery crash, becomes prime suspect in a series of murders, but could the real killer have already died?

programme.title: Eye See You
programme.desc: After witnessing a brutal scene on the job, a shaken cop checks into a rehab clinic, where he finds his fellow patients are being murdered one by one.

programme.title: Maneater
programme.desc: When an escaped Bengal tiger terrorizes a small Appalachian town, it’s up to the local sheriff, a game-hunter, and a gifted boy to stop the creature.

programme.title: Raging Sharks
programme.desc: A bizarre outbreak of shark attacks leave the crew of an underwater outpost in desperate trouble, while a Navy submarine delivers fresh dangers.

programme.title: Living Dark: The Story of Ted the Caver
programme.desc: Based on an internet legend, the tale of reunited brothers traces their descent into a cave, as they confront the nightmare that killed their father.

programme.title: The Pumpkin Karver
programme.desc: On the year anniversary that a man murdered his sister’s boyfriend, who he thought was a masked Halloween killer, a real masked killer comes knocking.

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: An Oxford University grad is horrified by the staff at a mental asylum he works for who are performing horrific and inhumane experimental treatments.

programme.title: The Music Box
programme.desc: An orphaned six-year-old is caught under the spell of a mysterious music box and it’s up to her aunt to save her before the last note plays.

programme.title: The Pit
programme.desc: When a solitary and strange adolescent boy makes a disturbing discovery in the depths of the forest, he wreaks vengeance on those who harass him.

programme.title: Wolvesbayne
programme.desc: When a vampire clan seeks to restore ancient evils, a posse of vampire hunters, led by Jacob Van Helsing and a newly-turned werewolf, must stop them.

programme.title: Zoombies
programme.desc: When a rapidly spreading virus turns animals of a safari park into the undead, those left inside must stop them before they zombify the whole city.

programme.title: Danika
programme.desc: A wife and mother of three lives a wonderful life, until her everyday worries begin to grow and manifest themselves in gruesome, horrific reality.

programme.title: Charlie's Farm
programme.desc: Ignoring warnings, four friends head into the Australian outback to visit the site where a violent family met their end at the hands of an angry mob.

programme.title: Hollow Creek
programme.desc: A popular horror novelist heads to spooky Appalachia in search of inspiration, and becomes the prime suspect in a missing person case.

programme.title: Ghosthunters
programme.desc: When one of their own loses his family to a serial killer, a team of ghost hunters is determined to find their spirits and help them rest in peace.

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: An army officer who returns to her hometown to contain an epidemic must fight to save her family from becoming flesh-eating zombies – or their lunch.

programme.title: The Stay Awake
programme.desc: The ghost of a serial killer, executed for murdering students at a Catholic girls' school, returns to take revenge on the current student body.

programme.title: An American Werewolf in Paris
programme.desc: An American tourist finds himself becoming involved with a French woman who also happens to be able to supernaturally turn into a werewolf.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: The survivor (Vincent Price) of a global epidemic battles a race of zombie vampires in an adaptation of Richard Matheson's "I Am Legend."

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: A family on holiday stop to pick up a mysterious hitch-hiker.

programme.title: Hammer House of Horror
programme.desc: A former mental patient kills her would-be rapist, but his corpse returns from its secret grave.

programme.title: The Slumber Party Massacre
programme.desc: Trish's slumber party for her basketball teammates includes an unexpected guest.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: Sorority sisters are as good as dead when they're stalked by a psychopathic stranger over the Christmas holiday in this influential slasher.

programme.title: Summer of 84
programme.desc: Teenager Davey Armstrong is a conspiracy theorist who begins to suspect that a neighboring police officer is a serial killer. With help from three friends, Davey launches a daring investigation that soon turns dangerous.

programme.title: Hide and Go Shriek
programme.desc: To celebrate their high school graduation, a group of rowdy teens party in a furniture store, where a psychotic killer takes them down one by one.

programme.title: Mortuary
programme.desc: Christie Parson suspects her father’s recent drowning was no accident but, as she gets closer to the truth, she discovers a darker secret.

programme.title: Sleepaway Camp
programme.desc: Following the death of her family, Angela is sent to a camp for the summer. After her arrival, brutal accidents begin to kill the other campers.

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: After murdering his entire family, a man remarries a widow with a teenage daughter in another town and prepares to do the same thing all over again.

programme.title: Stepfather II
programme.desc: After cheating death by surviving being both stabbed and shot, psychotic killer Jerry (Terry O'Quinn) is placed in a mental institution, but he soon murders his doctor and escapes. Taking on a dead man's identity, he moves to an upscale neighborhood in Los Angeles and sets his sights on local woman Carol (Meg Foster), slowly winning her heart. Carol's son, Todd (Jonathan Brandis), grows suspicious of his mom's new lover, however, and tensions reach the boiling point at the couple's wedding.

programme.title: Stepfather III: Father's Day
programme.desc: An escaped madman (Robert Wightman) romances a California divorcee; luckily her son knows how to use a computer.

programme.title: ALTER Collection
programme.desc: A monster lives inside every animal and no one is safe from the creep underneath.

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: Cinematic and socially conscious, a horror showcase that lodges into your psyche.

programme.title: ALTER Files
programme.desc: A six-part episode featuring "Milk Teeth" by Felipe Vargas, "EMPTIED" by David Ferino, "The Tooth Fairy" by Tyler Glodt, "Teeth" by Daniel Gray and Tom Brown, "Sweet Tooth" by Michael Muchnij, and "The End of All Things" by Norma Vila.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for one of the highlights of the horticultural year, the annual 'Gardeners' World Live' event. Monty Don, Nick Bailey, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, and Frances Tophill are on hand to bring the best the gardening world has to offer. There is design inspiration for even the smallest of spaces, plus big ideas on display in the show gardens, and all the latest trends and must-have plants and flowers in the floral marquee.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty advises on plants for a late summer display, tackles his overgrown wildlife pond and shows which roses to prune now for a repeat flowering in late summer. Frances Tophill travels to Birmingham where she shows that every space counts by transforming three tiny balconies into spaces full of colour and scent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The vegetable garden is at its peak now and as well as harvesting, Monty takes a look at how his autumn crops are faring as well as giving tips on how to keep the garden looking at its best. Adam Frost returns to Leicester where he has been helping to create a garden from scratch on a new build estate, and Frances Tophill celebrates the summer harvest on her shared allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team set out on a horticultural adventure to celebrate the south Asian influences on British gardens. Monty Don visits a Hindu temple in Neasden, London, to learn more about the melding of two cultures: the traditional Hindu Mandir and its suburban London location.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of advice from pruning blackcurrants, taking cuttings and planting bulbs for flowering this Autumn. Carol Klein finds a collection of plants that are at their peak right now and gives her advice on how to grow one of the late summer garden stunners, the monarda while Adam Frost makes the finishing touches to the Leicestershire couple's garden which he helped them start from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardening show packed with good ideas, tips, advice from experts and timely reminders.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a bridge in a forest.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: The sounds of quiet waters, the sight of velvety green shrubs and the hint of distance foothills in a perfect scene of relaxation.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A happy little winterscape, inside a happy little oval - with homey barn and lacy bushes -- another real Bob Ross classic.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Misty background evergreens and cheerful blue sky give Bob Ross the perfect setting for this lovely birch tree painting.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: The soft sky and snow-blanketed ground give this cozy barn a quiet place to sleep and dream awhile; Bob Ross paint brushes make it happen.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A fantastic Bob Ross seascape today - enjoy the golden, pink and mauve tones in the sky and crashing waves.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Even a tiny shanty by the pond can be a warm place in the dead of winter - Bob Ross shows us how to make a snow scene glow!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Follow the old dirt road to that quaint country barn nestled in nature's greenery - Bob Ross paints your destination today.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Supple sky, fluffy trees and playful rushing river are created by Bob Ross, simply from correcting common mistakes on canvas.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a beautiful monochromatic scene with delicate leafless trees and rich grassy meadow cuddling a sweet cottage.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Magnificent jewels in an oval - this Bob Ross painting highlights countless numbers of colors in nature's sky and foliage.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Elegant mountain lake, silent and still, reflecting the natural beauty of leafy trees and grasses all around - a pretty Bob Ross creation.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Brandon Vargas, who leads them off the shore Duck Key to an exciting batch of offshore permit.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Brandon Vargas, as they continue from an earlier flurry of offshore permit catches to a variety of fun offshore targets.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the Everglades for whatever may come, and that turns out to be some exciting action near the mangroves with snook and baby tarpon.
